name: Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We normally stay at super nice resorts - time is precious and when we go on a holiday we go all out. BUT, this time we were travelling with another couple and I know they would not have been comfortable paying more. So, I spent a ton of time researching for a nice place that didn't break the bank and we all stayed here. We just returned 2 days ago from 5 days here. I read ALL the reviews on this site and my first reaction that I would love to say to many of the people on here is "you get what you pay for". So, if you book a standard room, you will get a standard room. If you are staying at a nice hotel, the drinks and food are going to be spendier. That's just how it works.
reviews.title: The WHOLE scoop from someone who normally stays at a Ritz or Four Seasons....

likes.disliked: — turndown service just didn't happen sometimes

reviews.title: Top Notch !
reviews.text: So, we booked a junior suite and I HIGHLY recommend that. It had a huge patio that had 2 full lounge chairs exactly like the ones at the pool and a huge couch and a table with 2 chairs. You could throw a party on it. It overlooked the pool and thus the ocean front - it was fabulous. The furnishings were mexican style and beautiful, the bathroom was nice - spacious, etc. The room was quiet. One thing that bothered me was that sometimes the turndown service in the evening just didn't occur! That would never be the case at a ritz, etc. So call as you head out for dinner and ask housekeeping to come and do the turn down. Ok that was the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the pool area --- many nice comfortable chairs. If there is a large group there (as there was during our stay and that is a little irritating) then chairs are a 'little' difficult to come by. I found the pool menu for food to be really good! Quesadilla's, fajita's, that were good and great portions. not cheap, but again ----why should they be?? We had lunch daily at our lounge chairs by the pool. Breakfast one day at The Hacienda was excellent - they had a huge buffet with many healthy options if you wanted that. We did not dine in the evening there as we tried stuff outside the hotel (which i can also recommend great restaurants if you want to drop me a note). The service was ok, I feel people raved about this maybe too much in their reviews. I felt i had to flag someone down at the pool actually so i wouldn't consider that 'great service'.
reviews.title: Perfect for our 10 year Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other little complaint was that our room was not available when we checked in which was right at their posted check in time of 3 pm. We had to wait about a half hour. Again something that would NEVER happen at a ritz, etc. This probably happened as i overheard the desk guy telling the woman next to me that the hotel is "oversold". Wonder what they did with the guests who didn't get a room???
reviews.title: Perfect Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The spa was very nice -had a great massage there.
reviews.title: Very Good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The check in was pretty bad..couldn't even understand what the guy was saying. They try to make it nice by checking in at the lobby bar so you can have beverages and sit down, etc. but it was just a hassle. It took longer than it should have. Walking to your room can be very confusing because of the way the hotel is laid out. Our rooms were very nice though and big...great beds and bathroom. L'occitane bath products and other nice amenities. Our room was considered an "ocean-front"..but it really was an ocean view. This hotel is VERY big and confusing..there are so many restaurants and its hard to figure out which one to eat at for which meal. Breakfast was not relaxing at all..kids running around everywhere barefoot...just LOTS of kids. If you have no kids, or older kids who dont need constant entertainment, then you should not stay here. If you have kids, then this is a great place..there are so many activities (ceramics, cooking lessons, bonfires, etc.)..you can pretty much let them run around from breakfast all the way until dinner. There's 2 pools..one is supposed to be an adult pool but there were young kids swimming in it?? There were strict rules regarding lounge chairs ... but I would advise going out early to reserve some because otherwise it can be tough if you are there during the high season. There is a very nice beach and you can sit on the beach..it is also a swimming beach, which there arent too many in Cabo. Upon checkout, called for a bellman to get the bags..never showed up? Also, at your nightly turndown, you can request what kind of treat you would like (i.e. something sweet, salty, fruit, etc.)..which is a nice touch. If you are staying here, you know what you're getting. Overall it is a nice place to stay, and if you have kids who would like activities, then I would definitely recommend it. For a Hilton, it is definitely one of their nicer resorts. It is in a good location - in between San Jose del Cabo and Cabo San Lucas --about 20 minute drives to each, and about 25 mins. from airport. However, if you are seeking a relaxing vacation where it is quiet and you don't want to keep reading the same sentence over and over in your book..then go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great for kids, but otherwise...

likes.disliked: — checking in, layout, noise from kids, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: We were so pleasantly surprised... Upon our arrival, we were welcomed with warm greetings and tasty marqaritas. Our room was immaculate and spacious and the view, breathtaking.
reviews.title: Great Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every employee was so eager to please and succeeded. The infinity pool was magnificent... overlooking the sea, which by the way, was swimable. And you couldn't beat the weather. The location turned out to be perfect, situated midway between Cabo San Lucas and Cabo San Jose... both towns that we cabbed to for dinner in the evening. The concierge staff was patient and guided us to wonderful restaurants... The only negatives were that it was expensive (but well worth it)... and that we had to leave...
reviews.title: loved the changes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton Dec 12th - 19th and loved the changes that have been made since our last visit 5 years ago. Although there was some construction going on during the visit we did not feel it in any way impacted the experience we had at the Hilton. The staff was excellent and we never had to wait to be served either at the front desk, the conciege, the restaurants or pool side. It was obvious that alot of time and effort has gone into making customer service the top piority of management. There was always a smile and a greeting. Comments about the prices of food & beverages at the hotel are unrealistic. Cabo is probably the most expensive destination in Mexico. This is a beautiful property with an outstanding staff and the prices are well worth it.
reviews.title: Hilton los Cabos-Wonderful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are looking for a lower values experience go to Puerto Vallarta or Matzalan. We have been to Mexico 15 times and this was by far the best hotel and best vacation we have had. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Great family destination!! We will definitely go back.

likes.liked: — The view, the pool, and the day care service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited the Los Cabos Hilton to celebrate my 40th birthday (September 22-27).
reviews.title: Birthday Celebration in Cabo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were welcomed with complimentary margaritas and cheerful service. The unexpected bonus occurred when we were taken to our room and found it fully decorated for a birthday celebration complete with an incredible chocolate-raspberry cake (the best that I have EVER tasted) and special Bvalgari gifts. This was provided without our knowledge as a special treat for being a HiltonHonors Gold member. It was the perfect beginning to our trip.
reviews.title: Hilton Lose Cabos - Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The facility is unmatched. Immaculate - stylish - spotless. The infinity pool is the highlight of property - the finest that I have seen. We spent many, many hours with a drink in hand, starring at the sapphire water and crashing waves.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The service is fantastic and very friendly. No issues at all.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note - don't miss the homemade salsa cart at La Hacienda. Delightfully fresh salsa prepared at your table to your specific taste. Wonderful.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Los Cabos from December 28, 2007 through 1/3/2008. The hotel and staff were wonderful. They couldn't do enough for you.
reviews.title: great experience

likes.disliked: — room did not have a great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I would say that Cabo is one of the most expensive places we've ever stayed, including Paris. But the weather was beautiful, and the views to the sea were spectacular. Clear starry nights and balmy days.
reviews.title: Very Very Posh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We played three rounds of golf (expensive but gorgeous course), did an ATV tour on the beach, and took a boat ride to the Arches. Very touristy town, especially when cruise ship is in. Some good restaurants in town, but overall I would say go for the pure relaxation and bring money!!!
reviews.title: Keeps Getting Better Every Year!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had our honeymoon at the Hilton, on the time share end. Place is very different than where we got married (see review of Dreams resort). This place is very upscale, more suited for the blue hairs, where Dreams is for the average Joe. $12 margaritas tasted very very good, but would break my bank getting drunk. Service was outstanding and so was the food. Come here is you want to try different things.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Christmas Week!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool was outstanding....bath water like. Hot tub was very hot....just perfect. The Hilton beach is one of the few beaches you can go in the ocean. They have a cove that breaks the waves and mitigates any undertow. This is very unique in cabo.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel, Outstanding Service, Excellent Food, Quite Expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I reserved the most expensive ocean front room and when we got to the room, there was a hugh white tent that blocked our ocean view, should have been called a "tent front" view. Nothing was ever said about this when we checked in. Then again, with nothing said, we find out that they were having LOUD parties in that tent, right outside our "ocean tent front room till 1am-2am in the morning..again, nothing ever said, when I called the management, at 1am in the morning,they acted like it was no big deal. It was a big deal to us that we could not get any sleep. Then, first thing in the morning, the deluxe floor we were on was being renovated and the workers were there first thing in the morning so it was impossible to sleep in. I found it absolutely disgusting that a hotel would have the gall to put people in a room right next to where they were having their week long employee party and not even give a guest any warning at all that they would be kept up half the night. I have stayed in 20 Four Seasons hotels, all over the world not to mention other top resorts and this was the worst experience of my life. I would have had a better time if i booked a room under a subway in Brooklyn, At least I would have known what to expect. For this, this hotel deserves a zero rating in every category and I have to say that they ruined my vacation. I can be reimbursed for the room but my time cannot be reimburesed as like most people reading this review, I only have a few days off and when the time is up...it is up. I cannot recommend this property LESS and advise ALL readers to STAY AWAY from this hotel. Perhaps this will show this hotel that they cannot treat people like this. There is absoutely NO response from management that can detract from this horrible experience. They put us in a room that they KNEW would be right next to their employee party and said nothing. I had asked for a different room on check in cause I wanted to be higher, and even though the hotel was empty, they refused to change us. In the end, they made their money and obviously that is all they cared about but in the process, they ruined the precious few days I had off to spend with my family. I will NEVER stay in another Hilton ever again.
reviews.title: nightmare

likes.disliked: — that I could not get any sleep cause of the noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is one of the best stays I have ever had at a hotel. The hotel was absolutely beautiful. The pool is definately the highlight. Our room was newly renovated with a huge bathroom with a to-die-for shower and separate bath.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay, Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could not say enough about the friendliness of the staff. They went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. Definately stay a few days at the Hilton!
reviews.title: Great Resort On A Beautiful Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton Los Cabos is located on "The Corridor", between the towns of Cabo San Lucas and San Jose del Cabo. The resort sits on a bluff overlooking a beautiful beach, with awesome views of the Sea of Cortez. We visited the Hilton from 11/29 - 12/06/06.
reviews.title: Flawless service at an exquisite resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Resort:
reviews.title: great place to relax

likes.liked: — The service from the staff and the layout of the complex
likes.disliked: — Elevators to the pool area were not easy to find at first

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I couldn't possibly have asked for a more romantic, adventurous, luxurious week away from New York City. Upon arrival, check-in was unbelievably smooth and we were immediately served two frozen margaritas. The staff was impeccable - the most polite we've ever seen.
reviews.title: A PERFECT Week-long Escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were led to our suite which was massive - a huge sitting area, a king-size bed, a large bathroom with whirpool tub and European-style shower and separate toilet, and large French doors that opened onto the veranda. We had a view of the Sea of Cortez and even left the balcony doors open at night so that we could sleep to the sound of the waves and the warm ocean breeze.
reviews.title: outstanding!!!

likes.disliked: — check weather before you go in the fall - hurricane season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The week was spent lounging at the infinity pool (in January the pool was pretty quiet and we had no problems finding chairs), hanging out at the swim-up bar (which served sushi as well), drinking pina coladas (you should have seen our bar tab!), brunching at La Hacienda (the brunch is around $20 or less per person but served buffet style and outdoors), and relaxing at Spa Ixchel (I received a nice paraffin manicure / pedicure).
reviews.title: Beautiful pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: Except for brunch at La Hacienda, we didn't eat at any of the Hilton's restaurants. Instead, we rented a car and drove into Los Cabos or San Jose each evening and enjoyed FANTASTIC meals. Our last evening at the Hilton we walked over to Las Ventanas and had an unforgettable meal there (make reservations ahead of time!).
reviews.title: Great Facility, but note change at Lobby Bar
Worst hotel in Los Cabos
reviews.text: Also - make sure to take the time to go horseback riding, beach bumming, shopping in San Jose, and private boating it out to Lover's Beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is breathtaking! Should be 5 stars. From the minute we arrived at the hotel, i was blown away. Our ocean front suite room 6030, overlooked the infinity pool and the sea of cortez.. The balcony with 2 chairs was so spacious. The junior suite was a very nice, with the jacuzzi being my favorite part of the room. Most of 6 days were spent around the infinity pool in the comfortable recliner chairs with the nice umbrellas to block any unwanted sun. The poolside food and drinks were all delicious and you can find a great selection. Yes, my favorite drink was the mudslide at $11.50 a drink, but hey, it was vacation! I am going to write a trip report with what i did each day, but just wanted to say that i was so HAPPY with my choice of the Hilton. The service and the hotel staff were top notch. Did not come across one unplesant employee. Everyone was so nice and helpful. I will definity return!
reviews.title: Fantastic!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Los Cabos August 26- September 2, 2006. We unfortunately had to leave on August 31 due to Hurricane John. The Hilton is absolutely magnificent! We stayed in the Casa Dorada wing of the hotel, which is the time-share section. There is a sign with the Hilton on one side and Casa Dorada on the other, for some reason this sign always amused me since there is so much confusion on this web site as to where Casa Dorada is (through Interval International) and it just comes down to a sign in the hallway indicating the different "names".
reviews.title: The Best Resort!!

likes.liked: — Beautiful, large room, large bathroom, very clean, just breath-taking!
likes.disliked: — Had to leave early due to Hurricane John.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides being a stunning hotel, staying at the Hilton through the time-share was great, we were given a 20% off card upon our arrival (along with the margaritas) and we could use this for pretty much anything at the hotel! Nice perk!! :)
reviews.title: Exellent Stay at Hilton Los Cabos

likes.disliked: — Prices on the drinks by the pool were a little excessive.

reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.text: We had a hard time leaving the Hilton because it was so nice, I loved the pool and just wanted to spend all of my time there! Because we spent so much time in the pool, we missed out on some sightseeing that we wanted to do (since we had to leave 2 days early). So, now we have to go back!

reviews.title: Excellent, excellent, excellent!
reviews.text: The staff at the Hilton was great! Everyone was so nice and friendly, they were all smiling all of the time! My boyfriend had caught some fish on a fishing trip and they cooked it up for us, made us feel very important and special about the whole thing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed there 3 nights for a convention back in August.
reviews.title: Good for what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Big enclosed resorts are not really my cup of tea, but for those who like it the Hilton is a good option. I mean, the facilities are first class rooms are spacious and well appointed (in a stereotype sort of way). Mine was a ground floor room with a smallish private front patio.
reviews.title: really quiet

likes.liked: — beautiful rooms and property, excellent service
likes.disliked: — very expensive and seemingly unfriendly guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must say that going to a great country like Mexico to be bunkered in a compound were you may spend your entire stay without even having to hear Spanish or even exchanging your Dollars into Pesos is not my idea of a trip.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, friendly staff

likes.liked: — The continual view of the ocean from everywhere in the resort.
likes.disliked: — The resort bus to town was not operating the day we went shopping.

reviews.title: What a terrific hotel!
reviews.text: But if relaxation and piece o mind are your priorities over cultural experience the HIlton is a good option.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family stayed here one night on points. The hotel is truly lovely. It is very quiet there and most people at the pool were just reading in their chairs. I was afraid of my kids making noise. Most of the pool is too deep for kids 6 and younger anyway, and the water a little chilly. It is very expensive to stay there. $10 each for a smoothie and cold cereal order. The dinner menu was about $35 for a chicken entree and $75 for the lobster. That wasn't what we wanted to spens, but figure $25 each way into Cabo san Lucas, and it gets expensive.
reviews.title: Amazing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Four of us stayed for eight days and seven nights and had a wonderful time. Pool area, room (very clean) and service throughout the hotel was very, very good. No complaints whatsoever about the Hilton - one of the best name brand hotel resorts I have stayed at including a Four Seasons.
reviews.title: Outstanding Stay at the Los Cabo Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We did hear that some people had a theft problem but we did not and always felt quite safe.
reviews.title: Beware of your valuables

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: American Airlines on the other hand ... well, I think they should reinvent / rename itself. Keep the AA just change the name to Awful Airlines! Canceled direct flights (that we had make nine month ahead of time at additional cost), numerous delays (six hours late getting to Cabo) and lost baggage for two days. When I was checking in to go home they asked me if I had ever received my bags!
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton in Cabo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be VERY VERY careful here. This beautiful property has a major theft problem. Several of our group experienced theft of valuables, SOME from the safe in the room. There is obviously an "inside job" going on here that the management can not acknowledge for liability reasons. All hotel safes have an "override" code-- do NOT let them tell you otherwise. This is obviously a large problem: as I was reporting our theft, another lady was reporting hers--- the manager "slithered" away not wanting to hear it. They can not even acknowledge the problem for fear of liability-- BEWARE. There are many other beautiful choices that will protect you and your valuables. Choose one of them or leave any thing of value at home. Feel free to reach me if you want itemized details. sailor1932@att.net
reviews.title: Great Service

likes.disliked: — The cost of the shuttlle& food at the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from Cabo two days ago and we had an amazing time at the Hilton in Cabo. We stayed in a junior suite overlooking the ocean and we were very happy with the room. The staff was very professional at the hotel. We had dinner two nights at La Hacienda and enjoyed the food. However, we were not impressed by the breakfast buffet at La Hacienda - the buffet was pricey ($27 per person) and half of the food we had wasn't warm. The pool and the pool area was beautiful. We didn't have any problems getting lounge chairs by the pool - the chairs were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Marriott timeshare owner..Not Impressed

likes.disliked: — Too far out not enough activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton for our 9 year anniversary the first week of November. It was wonderful! We were greeted the moment we arrived, bell men taking our bags and a nice gentleman escorting us to a table overlooking the pool and ocean to check in. After bringing us complementary, yummy margaritas; he then told us all about our room and the resort.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was 5022. We had booked an ocean view versus ocean front. We had a nice view of the ocean and main pool area. Our travel agent informed the resort it was an anniversary trip and upon entering our room we discovered balloons, swans and rose petals on the bed and a bottle of wine with cheese, crackers and fruit. The room was very nice. Plenty of room and nice furnishings. Typical refreshment bar, however, no coffee maker. I knew this before we went, so I brought my own. Some people may not care about a coffee maker, but it is very important to me, so I travel with my own when I know one will not be available. The bathroom was very nice and spacious.
reviews.title: RELAX-CHILL-POOL PERFECT

likes.liked: — Pool service and food - swim up restaurants
likes.disliked: — Deli wasn't robost in its food or beverage selections.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is two pools. The main infinity pool and a quieter pool on the other side. That is where we camped for the week. Very serene with beautiful views of the ocean, pool bar and restaraunt with great service. They wouldn't let you do anything yourself, A nice boy, Rodolfo, set up our chairs every morning.
reviews.title: Amazing Experience - And I Can Be Picky!

likes.disliked: — Far from Cabo San Lucas downtown, but that was ok too...quieter here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the food that we ate was very good. We had room service breakfast and the breakfast buffet at El Mason. Both were delicious. There is a wonderful guitar player in the restaraunt during breakfast. A nice touch. We bought the CD in the gift shop to remind us of the trip and it's very good.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton

likes.liked: — The serivce provided by all staff members

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For lunch we ate at La Barca which is the restaraunt by our pool. The pizzas are yummy! Also had nachos and turkey sandwhich that were good as well.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon At The Hilton!!!

likes.liked: — The service, the amazing pool, the food and drinks, the view from the rooms, etc etc etc...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where should I BEGIN?!?! This was a dream destination for my husband and I and was so pleased that Hilton was offering a special for this past summer ( July 2008) so we decided to go for our Anniversary! The best decision we could have EVER made!
reviews.title: Viva Hilton Los Cabos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: *Accommodations*
reviews.title: We'll be back!

likes.liked: — The service and the resort itself.
likes.disliked: — In the middle of nowhere and the expensive restaurants!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are GORGEOUS and so spacious! We stayed in a partial ocean view room which was plenty of the ocean we needed! I made a note that we would be vacationing for our anniversary and they sent a complimentary wine, cheese, fruit and cracker spread to our room already waiting for us when we checked in!! SO SWEET!! They even spelled our Happy Anniversary in shells on our bed spread! Really incredible! The bathroom was enormous and had enough space for a football team! The jetted tub, walk in shower, double sinks and marble trimming made me feel like I NEVER wanted to leave the room! The pics on the site are exactly what you'd get and in person, even better!
reviews.title: Nice Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *Food*
reviews.title: Hats off to Hilton!

likes.disliked: — Internet service spotty--but who should be on the internet when you vacation anyway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I will admit that the food was pricey (and so were the drinks) it was absolutely delicious! The more "fancy"/expensive (pool level) restaurant had a variety of food but my favorite was the 2nd level restaurant...just delicious! The breakfast buffet...also, very expensive ($30 per person) but to die for! You name it, they had it OR would get it to you! we went to Walmart often and stocked up on drinks and breakfast pastries and sandwich stuff for lunch sometimes. Balance it out and you'll be fine! OH!!! Make sure you take a trip to San Jose del Cabo and eat at Tropicana!!! A MUST!!! They have a live Mariachi band and AMAZING and AFFORDABLE food!! :o) There's also a great Italian place in the Downtown Los Cabos area but I can't remember the name! It's a father and son owner from New Jersey. Huge portions and great food & prices!
reviews.title: Be treated like Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Los Cabos in August 2008 to get married and for our honeymoon, and it was an amazing stay! The hotel is so beautiful and the staff is top notch! The communication via email with the banquet/wedding staff was trying with the language barrier, however we were pleased with how the entire wedding worked out. Its not a cheap place to stay, $20 burger is a little steep, however its a vacation... Nothing is ever cheap. I would definately recommend this hotel for a relaxing beautiful location!!
reviews.title: Absolutely Gorgeous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This resort is picture perfect! It is just as good, if not better, than the pictures you will see on the Hilton website. They offer top-notch service and the staff is very friendly, as well as professional.
reviews.title: Picture perfect!
Special treat for my 50th birthday
reviews.text: If you're there for more than a few days, you will definitely want to explore local restaurants. Although there are several very good restaurants at the resort, the options and menus will seem limited after several days.

reviews.title: Perfect Getaway!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Los Cabos Nov 15 - 19, 2008. When making the reservation, I mentioned that it was my birthday and when we arrived, our room was fully decorated with everything from balloons and streamers to champagne, chocolates and chocolate cake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airport was an experience. I could not believe how brazen the time share sales people were. The actually lied and told us they were from our shuttle service. The time share people are inside the airport, dont stop, just keep going till you get outside the building!
reviews.title: Perfect place for a honeymoon

likes.disliked: — price of basic foods and drinks

aka: Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Hotel
description: The Hilton Los Cabos Beach & Golf Resort offers one of the few swimmable beaches in Los Cabos and a variety of both lively and leisurely activities for guests to enjoy. The hotel was designed to reflect the rich Spanish heritage of Mexico, featuring tiled roofs and a hacienda courtyard featuring a large, elevated, cascading pond exemplifies its relaxed ambience. Guestrooms feature colorful textures, hand-hewn treatments and exquisite furnishings, Italian-marble bathrooms feature rainfall showerheads and separate oversized bathtubs.
